title: Ancient Plague's Spread Decoded: Sheep and the Bronze Age Mystery
description: Researchers have discovered evidence of the ancient plague bacterium, Yersinia pestis, in the tooth of a Bronze Age sheep, offering a new clue about how the disease spread across Eurasia during the Bronze Age, challenging previous assumptions about its transmission.

title: Ancient plague mystery cracked after DNA found in 4,000-year-old animal remains

title: Ancient plague mystery cracked after DNA found in 4,000-year-old animal remains
description: Scientists discover Bronze Age plague DNA in 4,000-year-old sheep remains, shedding light on how ancient diseases spread between animals and humans across Eurasia.

title: Rising Waters of Lonar Lake Threaten Ancient Temples
description: A sudden increase in the water levels at the iconic Lonar Lake in Maharashtras Buldhana district poses a threat to its ancient temples some over 1200 years old prompting concern from conservationists and researchers The site the worlds largest basaltic impact crater was formed 50000 years ago by a meteor strike
